summary.para: Copies the data from another topology node into this node.

param.name: pNode
param.para: A pointer to the interface of the node to copy.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

description.para: The node types do not match.

remarks.para: The two nodes must have the same node type. To get the node type, call .

This method copies the object pointer, preferred types, and attributes from pNode to this node. It also copies the TOPOID that uniquely identifies each node in a topology. It does not duplicate any of the connections from pNode to other nodes.
The purpose of this method is to copy nodes from one topology to another. Do not use duplicate nodes within the same topology.

summary.para: Connects an output stream from this node to the input stream of another node.

param.name: dwOutputIndex
param.para: Zero-based index of the output stream on this node.

param.name: pDownstreamNode
param.para: Pointer to the interface of the node to connect to.

param.name: dwInputIndexOnDownstreamNode
param.para: Zero-based index of the input stream on the other node.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

remarks.para: Node connections represent data flow from one node to the next. The streams are logical, and are specified by index.

If the node is already connected at the specified output, the method breaks the existing connection. If dwOutputIndex or dwInputIndexOnDownstreamNode specify streams that do not exist yet, the method adds as many streams as needed.
This method checks for certain invalid conditions:

description.para: An output node cannot have any output connections. If you call this method on an output node, the method returns E_FAIL.
A node cannot be connected to itself. If pDownstreamNode specifies the same node as the method call, the method returns E_INVALIDARG.

remarks.para: However, if the method succeeds, it does not guarantee that the node connection is valid. It is possible to create a partial topology that the topology loader cannot resolve. If so, the method will fail.
To break an existing node connection, call .

summary.para: Disconnects an output stream on this node.

param.name: dwOutputIndex
param.para: Zero-based index of the output stream to disconnect.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

description.para: The dwOutputIndex parameter is out of range.
The specified output stream is not connected to another node.

remarks.para: If the specified output stream is connected to another node, this method breaks the connection.

summary.para: Retrieves the node that is connected to a specified input stream on this node.

param.name: dwInputIndex
param.para: Zero-based index of an input stream on this node.

param.name: ppUpstreamNode
param.para: Receives a pointer to the interface of the node that is connected to the specified input stream. The caller must release the interface.

param.name: pdwOutputIndexOnUpstreamNode
param.para: Receives the index of the output stream that is connected to this node's input stream.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

description.para: The index is out of range.
The specified input stream is not connected to another node.

summary.para: Retrieves the number of input streams that currently exist on this node.

param.name: pcInputs
param.para: Receives the number of input streams.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

remarks.para: The input streams may or may not be connected to output streams on other nodes. To get the node that is connected to a specified input stream, call .
The and methods add new input streams as needed.

summary.para: Retrieves the preferred media type for an input stream on this node.

param.name: dwInputIndex
param.para: Zero-based index of the input stream.

param.name: ppType
param.para: Receives a pointer to the interface of the media type. The caller must release the interface.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

description.para: This node does not have a preferred input type.
This node is a source node.

remarks.para: Source nodes cannot have inputs. If this method is called on a source node, it returns E_NOTIMPL.

The preferred input type provides a hint to the topology loader. In a fully resolved topology, there is no guarantee that every topology node will have a preferred input type. To get the actual media type for a node, you must get a pointer to the node's underlying object. (For more information, see enumeration.)

param.name: pType
param.para: Receives the node type, specified as a member of the enumeration.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

summary.para: Gets the object associated with this node.

param.name: ppObject
param.para: Receives a pointer to the object's IUnknown interface. The caller must release the interface.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

description.para: There is no object associated with this node.

summary.para: Retrieves the node that is connected to a specified output stream on this node.

param.name: dwOutputIndex
param.para: Zero-based index of an output stream on this node.

param.name: ppDownstreamNode
param.para: Receives a pointer to the interface of the node that is connected to the specified output stream. The caller must release the interface.

param.name: pdwInputIndexOnDownstreamNode
param.para: Receives the index of the input stream that is connected to this node's output stream.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

description.para: The index is out of range.
The specified input stream is not connected to another node.

summary.para: Retrieves the number of output streams that currently exist on this node.

param.name: pcOutputs
param.para: Receives the number of output streams.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

remarks.para: The output streams may or may not be connected to input streams on other nodes. To get the node that is connected to a specific output stream on this node, call .
The and methods add new input streams as needed.

summary.para: Retrieves the preferred media type for an output stream on this node.

param.name: dwOutputIndex
param.para: Zero-based index of the output stream.

param.name: ppType
param.para: Receives a pointer to the interface of the media type. The caller must release the interface.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

description.para: This node does not have a preferred output type.
This node is an output node.

remarks.para: Output nodes cannot have outputs. If this method is called on an output node, it returns E_NOTIMPL.

The preferred output type provides a hint to the topology loader. In a fully resolved topology, there is no guarantee that every topology node will have a preferred output type. To get the actual media type for a node, you must get a pointer to the node's underlying object. (For more information, see enumeration.)

summary.para: Retrieves the identifier of the node.

param.name: pID
param.para: Receives the identifier.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: When a node is first created, it is assigned an identifier. Node identifiers are unique within a topology, but can be reused across several topologies. The topology loader uses the identifier to look up nodes in the previous topology, so that it can reuse objects from the previous topology.
To find a node in a topology by its identifier, call .

summary.para: Sets the preferred media type for an input stream on this node.

param.name: dwInputIndex
param.para: Zero-based index of the input stream.

param.name: pType
param.para: Pointer to the interface of the media type.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

description.para: This node is a source node.

remarks.para: The preferred type is a hint for the topology loader.
Do not call this method after loading a topology or setting a topology on the Media Session. Changing the preferred type on a running topology can cause connection errors.
If no input stream exists at the specified index, the method creates new streams up to and including the specified index number.
Source nodes cannot have inputs. If this method is called on a source node, it returns E_NOTIMPL.

summary.para: Sets the object associated with this node.

param.name: pObject
param.para: A pointer to the object's IUnknown interface. Use the value NULL to clear an object that was previous set.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

remarks.para: All node types support this method, but the object pointer is not used by every node type.
If the object supports IPersist, IPersistStorage, or IPersistPropertyBag, the method gets the object's CLSID and sets the MF_TOPONODE_TRANSFORM_OBJECTID attribute on the node.

summary.para: Sets the preferred media type for an output stream on this node.

param.name: dwOutputIndex
param.para: Zero-based index of the output stream.

param.name: pType
param.para: Pointer to the interface of the media type.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

description.para: This node is an output node.

remarks.para: The preferred type is a hint for the topology loader.
Do not call this method after loading a topology or setting a topology on the Media Session. Changing the preferred type on a running topology can cause connection errors.
If no output stream exists at the specified index, the method creates new streams up to and including the specified index number.
Output nodes cannot have outputs. If this method is called on an output node, it returns E_NOTIMPL

summary.para: Sets the identifier for the node.

param.name: ullTopoID
param.para: The identifier for the node.

returns.para: The method returns an HRESULT. Possible values include, but are not limited to, those in the following table.

description.para: The TOPOID has already been set for this object.

remarks.para: When a node is first created, it is assigned an identifier. Typically there is no reason for an application to override the identifier. Within a topology, each node identifier should be unique.

member.name: IMFTopologyNode
member.summary:
Represents a node in a topology. The following node types are supported:
Output node. Represents a media sink.
Source node. Represents a media stream.
Transform node. Represents a Media Foundation Transform (MFT).
Tee node. Delivers a media stream to two or more nodes.
To create a new node, call the function.
